questions.question: What is the output?
questions.explanation: Due to floating-point precision issues, 0.1 + 0.2 equals 0.30000000000000004, not exactly 0.3. This is a common issue in many programming languages.

questions.question: What will be logged?
questions.explanation: var is function-scoped. By the time setTimeout callbacks execute, the loop has finished and i is 3. All three callbacks log 3. Using let would fix this.

questions.question: What is the output?
questions.explanation: Regular functions have their own 'this' context (obj), but arrow functions inherit 'this' from their enclosing scope (likely window/undefined). obj.b() returns 1, obj.c() returns undefined.

questions.question: What will this output?
questions.explanation: typeof 1 returns 'number' (a string). typeof 'number' returns 'string'. The typeof operator always returns a string.

questions.question: What is the time complexity of this operation?
questions.explanation: Array.splice() has O(n) time complexity because it needs to shift all elements after the removed element to fill the gap.
